problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What is the rate of a chemical reaction defined as?
options: Change in volume per unit time
Change in temperature per unit time
Change in concentration per unit time
Change in mass per unit time
problems.hint: It's related to how fast reactants turn into products
problems.detailed: Reaction rate is defined as the change in concentration of a reactant or product per unit time.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: What happens to the rate of a reaction when the temperature is increased?
problems.hint: Think about how particle energy changes
problems.detailed: Increasing temperature increases the kinetic energy of particles, leading to more frequent and energetic collisions, thus increasing the reaction rate.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which unit is commonly used for reaction rate?
problems.hint: It’s a rate, so it involves time and concentration
problems.detailed: The rate of reaction is typically expressed in mol/L/s, meaning change in concentration per unit time.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: In a reaction, why does increasing the surface area of a solid reactant increase the rate?
options: It provides more area for collisions
problems.detailed: A larger surface area exposes more particles to collisions, increasing the frequency of successful collisions and thus the rate.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which of the following can be used to measure the rate of a gas-producing reaction?
problems.hint: Which tool measures gas volume directly?
problems.detailed: A gas syringe can be used to measure the volume of gas produced over time, which helps determine the rate of the reaction.
